title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Health (Alcohol)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Health (Alcohol) 

(Labelling) Regulations 2023.

text_raw:

2026

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: In these Regulations –
text_norm: 3 regulation - act 2018 mean public health (alcohol) act 2018 (no 24 2018) health information mean information referred paragraph (iv) (v) (vi) section 12(1) act 2018 health symbol mean symbol referred paragraph (2) regulation 5 health warning mean warning referred paragraph (1) (3) regulation 5 part 2 information alcohol product container

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 4. This Part applies to information on alcohol product containers.
text_raw: 4. This Part applies to information on alcohol product containers.
text_norm: 4 part applies information alcohol product container

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 5. (1) The following health warning is prescribed for the purpose of section
text_raw:
5. (1) The following health warning is prescribed for the purpose of section 
12(1)(i) of the Act of 2018 and shall, subject to Regulation 6, be set out in the 
form provided for in Schedule 1: 

“Drinking alcohol causes liver disease”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 26th May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [249] 3 

(2) The symbol set out in Schedule 2 is prescribed for the purpose of 
section 12(1)(ii) of the Act of 2018 and shall, subject to Regulation 6, be set 
out in the form provided for in Schedule 1. 

(3) The following health warning is prescribed for the purpose of section 
12(1)(iii) of the Act of 2018 and shall, subject to Regulation 6, be set out in the 
form provided for in Schedule 1: 

“There is a direct link between alcohol and fatal cancers”.
text_norm: 5 (1) following health warning prescribed purpose section 12(1)(i) act 2018 shall subject regulation 6 set form provided schedule 1 drinking alcohol cause liver disease  notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th may 2023 249 3 (2) symbol set schedule 2 prescribed purpose section 12(1)(ii) act 2018 shall subject regulation 6 set form provided schedule 1 (3) following health warning prescribed purpose section 12(1)(iii) act 2018 shall subject regulation 6 set form provided schedule 1 direct link alcohol fatal cancer

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 6. (1) Subject to Regulation 9, the health warnings and health symbol shall
text_raw:
6. (1) Subject to Regulation 9, the health warnings and health symbol shall 

be of the following proportions: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the surface area reserved for the health warning referred to in 
paragraph (1) of Regulation 5 shall have a width of not less than 
45 millimetres and height of not less than 10 millimetres and 
shall not contain anything other than that warning; 

the surface area reserved for the health symbol referred to in 
paragraph (2) of Regulation 5 shall have a width of not less than 
15 millimetres and height of not less than 15 millimetres and 
shall not contain anything other than that symbol, and 

the surface area reserved for the health warning referred to in 
paragraph (3) of Regulation 5 shall have a width of not less than 
45 millimetres and height of not less than 15 millimetres and 
shall not contain anything other than that warning. 

(2) The text of the health warnings shall be: 

(a) 

printed in Times New Roman bold type on a white background; 

(b) printed in upper-case type; 

(c) 

printed in colour Pantone reference 2035 or a like red colour and 
in indelible ink; 

(d) printed at such a font size so as to occupy the greatest possible 
proportion of the surface reserved for the text of the warning; 

(e) 

(f) 

printed in normal, weighted, regular typeface; 

positioned at the centre of each surface reserved for such 
warnings and in the same direction as the majority of other 
written information on the container. 

(3) The health symbol shall be: 

(a) 

printed at such size so as to occupy the greatest possible 
proportion of the surface reserved for the symbol; 

(b) printed in indelible ink in black and in colour Pantone reference 

2035 or a like red colour as provided for in Schedule 2; 

(c) 

printed on a white background; 

(d) printed in such manner that the red line across the human figure 

does not obscure the outline shape of the figure; 

 
 
 4 [249] 

(e) 

positioned at the centre of each surface reserved for such symbol 
and in the same direction as the majority of other written 
information on the container.

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 7. (1) Subject to Regulation 9 –
text_raw:
7. (1) Subject to Regulation 9 – 

(a) 

(b) 

the surface area reserved for the health information referred to in 
paragraphs (iv) and (v) of section 12(1) of the Act of 2018 shall 
have a width of not less than 15 millimetres and a height of not 
less than 15 millimetres and shall not contain anything other 
than the health information referred to in those paragraphs, 

the surface area reserved for the health information prescribed 
for the purposes of paragraph (vi) of section 12(1) of the Act of 
2018 shall have a width of not less than 45 millimetres and a 
height of not less than 5 millimetres and shall not contain 
anything other than the health information so prescribed. 

(2) The text of the health information referred to in section 12(1)(iv) and 

(v) of the Act of 2018 shall be: 

(a) 

printed in black Times New Roman bold type on a white 
background in the form set out in Schedule 1; 

(b) printed at such a font size so as to occupy the greatest possible 
proportion of the surface reserved for the health information; 

(c) 

printed in normal, weighted, regular typeface; 

(d) printed in lower-case type, other than as provided for in 

Schedule 1; 

(e) 

positioned at the centre of each surface reserved for such health 
information and in the same direction as the majority of other 
information on the container. 

(3) “Visit www.askaboutalcohol.ie” is prescribed for the purpose of section 

12(1)(vi) of the Act of 2018 and shall be: 

(a) 

printed in Times New Roman bold type on a white background 
in the form set out in Schedule 1; 

(b) printed in black indelible ink; 

(c) 

printed at such font size so as to occupy the greatest possible 
proportion of the surface reserved for the text; 

(d) printed in normal, weighted, regular typeface; 

(e) 

(f) 

printed in lower-case type other than the first letter which shall 
be in upper-case type; 

positioned at the centre of each surface reserved for such health 
information and in the same direction as the majority of other 
information on the container. 

 
 
 
 [249] 5
text_norm: 7 (1) subject regulation 9 - (a) (b) surface area reserved health information referred paragraph (iv) (v) section 12(1) act 2018 shall width le 15 millimetre height le 15 millimetre shall contain anything health information referred paragraph surface area reserved health information prescribed purpose paragraph (vi) section 12(1) act 2018 shall width le 45 millimetre height le 5 millimetre shall contain anything health information prescribed (2) text health information referred section 12(1)(iv) (v) act 2018 shall (a) printed black time new roman bold type white background form set schedule 1 (b) printed font size occupy greatest possible proportion surface reserved health information (c) printed normal weighted regular typeface (d) printed lower-case type provided schedule 1 (e) positioned centre surface reserved health information direction majority information container (3) visit www.askaboutalcohol.ie prescribed purpose section 12(1)(vi) act 2018 shall (a) printed time new roman bold type white background form set schedule 1 (b) printed black indelible ink (c) printed font size occupy greatest possible proportion surface reserved text (d) printed normal weighted regular typeface (e) (f) printed lower-case type first letter shall upper-case type positioned centre surface reserved health information direction majority information container 249 5

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 8. Subject to Regulation 9, the combined area reserved for the health
text_raw:
8. Subject to Regulation 9, the combined area reserved for the health 
warnings, health symbol and health information shall have a width of not less 
than 60 millimetres and a height of not less than 30 millimetres and shall be 
surrounded by a black border not less than one millimetre and not more than 2 
millimetres which shall appear outside the combined area reserved for the 
health warnings and health information.
text_norm: 8 subject regulation 9 combined area reserved health warning health symbol health information shall width le 60 millimetre height le 30 millimetre shall surrounded black border le one millimetre 2 millimetre shall appear outside combined area reserved health warning health information

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 9. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), in the case of an alcohol product the largest
text_raw:
9. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), in the case of an alcohol product the largest 
surface area of the container of which has an area of less than 80 square 
centimetres, the area reserved for the health warnings, health symbol and 
health information shall cover an area of not less than 75 per cent of the area 
provided in Regulations 6(1), 7(1) and 8 respectively. 

(2) The health warnings, health symbol and health information on the 
container of an alcohol product referred to in paragraph (1) may be attached to 
the container concerned by means of an adhesive flag label.
text_norm: 9 (1) subject paragraph (2) case alcohol product largest surface area container area le 80 square centimetre area reserved health warning health symbol health information shall cover area le 75 per cent area provided regulation 6(1) 7(1) 8 respectively (2) health warning health symbol health information container alcohol product referred paragraph (1) may attached container concerned mean adhesive flag label

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 10. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the health warnings, health symbol and
text_raw:
10. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the health warnings, health symbol and 

health information on the container of an alcohol product shall be – 

(a) 

(b) 

included as part of the manufacturer’s label attached to the 
container of the alcohol product, 

included on a sticker affixed to the container of the alcohol 
product, 

or 

(c) 

stencilled, marked, embossed or impressed on the container of 
the alcohol product. 

(2) The health warnings, health symbol and health information included on 
the container of an alcohol product in accordance with paragraph (1) shall be 
affixed in a manner that ensures – 

(a) 

(b) 

that they are not easily removable, and 

that they remain intact when the container of the alcohol product 
is opened. 

Document provided with alcohol sold in reusable containers 

PART 3
text_norm: 10 (1) subject paragraph (2) health warning health symbol health information container alcohol product shall - (a) (b) included part manufacturer label attached container alcohol product included sticker affixed container alcohol product (c) stencilled marked embossed impressed container alcohol product (2) health warning health symbol health information included container alcohol product accordance paragraph (1) shall affixed manner ensures - (a) (b) easily removable remain intact container alcohol product opened document provided alcohol sold reusable container part 3

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 11. (1) The document set out in Schedule 3 is prescribed for the purposes
text_raw:
11. (1) The document set out in Schedule 3 is prescribed for the purposes 

of section 12(3) of the Act of 2018. 

(2) The document prescribed in paragraph (1) shall: 

(a) 

(b) 

be printed on white paper of at least A4 size; 

contain the text set out in Schedule 3 in Times New Roman bold 
type of at least font size 24; 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [249] 

(c) 

(d) 

subject to paragraph (d), be in red font in upper-case type as set 
out in Schedule 3; and 

contain the information in relation to alcohol content and details 
of the website in black font in lower-case type as set out in 
Schedule 3. 

PART 4 

Notice to be displayed by licensee

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 12. (1) The notice set out in Schedule 4 is prescribed for the purpose of
text_raw:
12. (1) The notice set out in Schedule 4 is prescribed for the purpose of 

section 12(4) of the Act of 2018. 

(2) The notice prescribed in paragraph (1) shall: 

(a) 

be at least A4 size; 

(b) be printed on white paper or cardboard which may be laminated; 

(c) 

contain the text as set out in Schedule 4; 

(d) be printed in Times New Roman bold type of at least font size 

18; 

(e) 

(f) 

subject to paragraph (f), be in red font in upper-case type as set 
out in Schedule 4; 

contain the information in relation to alcohol content and details 
of the website in black font in lower-case type as set out in 
Schedule 4. 

(3) The holder of a licence shall display at least one notice referred to in 
paragraph (1) adjacent, or in close proximity, to each public entrance to his or 
her licenced premises. 

PART 5 

On-line sales of alcohol products
text_norm: 12 (1) notice set schedule 4 prescribed purpose section 12(4) act 2018 (2) notice prescribed paragraph (1) shall (a) least a4 size (b) printed white paper cardboard may laminated (c) contain text set schedule 4 (d) printed time new roman bold type least font size 18 (e) (f) subject paragraph (f) red font upper-case type set schedule 4 contain information relation alcohol content detail website black font lower-case type set schedule 4 (3) holder licence shall display least one notice referred paragraph (1) adjacent close proximity public entrance licenced premise part 5 on-line sale alcohol product

title: paragraphs (i) to (vi) of subsection (1) of section 12 of that Act on alcohol
heading: 13. (1) The text set out in Schedule 5 is prescribed for the purposes of
text_raw:
13. (1) The text set out in Schedule 5 is prescribed for the purposes of 
paragraphs (a) to (c) and paragraph (f) of section 12(5) of the Act of 2018 and 
shall be displayed on the website of the holder of a licence who sells or causes 
to be sold alcohol products on-line. 

(2) For the purposes of paragraph (1) the information shall – 

(a) 

be displayed on any page of the website on which an alcohol 
product or alcohol products are displayed for sale, 

(b) be clearly visible to a person viewing the website, and 

(c) 

appear in a clear legible script, in red font which shall be in 
upper-case type. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [249] 7 

(3) For the purposes of paragraphs (d) and (e) of section 12(5) of the Act of 
2018 the quantity in grams of alcohol and the energy value expressed in 
kilojoules and kilocalories of each alcohol product displayed on the website 
referred to in paragraph (1), shall – 

(a) 

be clearly visible to a person viewing the website, 

(b) 

appear in a clear legible script, in black font, and 

(c) 

be in close proximity to the description or representation of the 
product to which it applies. 

 
 
 
 8 [249]
